ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [Level (1 byte)] Server replies the same response for setting 0x00 or 0x01 of Level field if InputServerObject is an Attachment object.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] CopyFlags (1 byte): An 8-bit flag structure.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] This field defines the parameters of the FastTransfer download operation.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] The following table defines valid flags for the CopyFlags field: 0x01, 0x02, 0x04 and 0x08.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the flag name is Move(0x01)] This flag MUST only be set if the InputServerObject field is a Folder object or a Message object.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the flag name is Move(0x01)] If this flag is set, the FastTransfer operation is being configured as a logical part of a larger object move operation, as opposed to a copy operation.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the flag name is Move(0x01)] If this flag is set, the client will issue further operations such as deleting the moved messages from the source.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the flag name is Move(0x01)] If this flag is not set, the FastTransfer operation is not being configured as a logical part of a larger object move operation.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the flag name is Unused1(0x02)] This flag MUST be ignored on receipt.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R2712.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] Reply is the same whether Unused1(0x02) is set or not.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the flag name is Unused2(0x04)] This flag MUST be ignored on receipt.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R2713.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] Reply is the same whether Unused2(0x04) is set or not.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the flag name is Unused3(0x08)] This flag MUST be ignored on receipt.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R2714.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] Reply is the same whether Unused3(0x08) is set or not.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] SendOptions (1 byte): An 8-bit flag structure.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [SendOptions (1 byte)] The possible values for this structure are defined in section 2.2.3.1.1.1.1.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] PropertyTagCount (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyTagCount (2 bytes)] This value specifies the number of structures in the PropertyTags field.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyTagCount (2 bytes)] This value MUST NOT be set to 0x0000.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] PropertyTags (variable): An array of PropertyTag structures ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.9).

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyTags (variable)] This array specifies the properties and subobjects, as specified in section 2.2.1.7, to copy from the messaging object pointed to by the InputServerObject field.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyTags (variable)] Note that this field MUST NOT be considered when determining what properties and subobjects to copy for descendant subobjects of the InputServerObject field.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyTags (variable)] For more details about the effect of property and subobject filters on download operations, see section 3.2.5.10.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.7).
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Response Buffer] [ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Response Buffer] OutputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be the FastTransfer download context.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP Response Buffer] [OutputServerObject] This value MUST be present if and only if the value of the ReturnValue field equals Success (0x00000000).

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP] The RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.5) initializes a FastTransfer operation on a folder for downloading content and descendant subobjects of messages identified by a set of MID structures ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2).
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP] For more details about client behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.3.4.1 and section 3.3.4.2.1.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP] For more details about server behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.2.5.8.1 and 3.2.5.8.1.3.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.5).
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] InputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be a Folder object.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] MessageIdCount (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [MessageIdCount (2 bytes)] This value specifies the number of identifiers in the MessageIds field.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [MessageIdCount (2 bytes)] The value of this field MUST be greater than zero.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] MessageIds (variable): An array of 64-bit identifiers.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [MessageIds (variable)] This list specifies the MID structures ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2) of the messages to be copied.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [MessageIds (variable)] Messages MUST be contained by a folder identified by the InputServerObject field.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] CopyFlags (1 byte): An 8-bit flag structure.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] This field defines the parameters of the FastTransfer download operation.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] The following table defines valid bit flags for the CopyFlags field: 0x01, 0x02, 0x04, 0x08, 0x10 and 0x20.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is Move(0x01)] This bit flag MUST only be set if the value of the InputServerObject field is a Folder object.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is Move(0x01)] If this bit flag is set, the FastTransfer operation is being configured as a logical part of a larger object move operation, as opposed to a copy operation.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is Move(0x01)] If this bit flag is set, and the client will issue further operations such as deleting the moved messages from the source.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is Move(0x01)] If this bit flag is not set, the FastTransfer operation is not being configured as a logical part of a larger object move operation. For more details, see section 3.2.8.4.1.3.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is Unused1(0x02)] This bit flag MUST be ignored on receipt.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R2715.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] Reply is the same whether Unused1(0x02) is set or not.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is Unused2(0x04)] This bit flag MUST be ignored on receipt.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R2716.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] Reply is the same whether 0x04[Unused2] is set or not.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is Unused3(0x08)] The client MUST NOT set this flag.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is BestBody(0x10)] This bit flag MAY<5> identify whether the output message body is in the original format or compressed RTF format.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R499001, MS-OXCFXICS_R499003.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is BestBody(0x10)] For more details, see section 3.2.5.8.1.3.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is SendEntryId(0x20)] This bit flag indicates whether message change information is included in the FastTransfer stream.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R3132, MS-OXCFXICS_R3134.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is SendEntryId(0x20)] If this bit flag is set, the PidTagSourceKey (section 2.2.1.2.5), PidTagChangeKey (section 2.2.1.2.7), PidTagLastModificationTime ([MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.2.2) and PidTagPredecessorChangeList (section 2.2.1.2.8) properties are included in the FastTransfer stream.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is SendEntryId(0x20)] [If this bit flag is set] In addition, the value of the PidTagEntryId property ([MS-OXCPERM] section 2.2.4) is assigned to the PidTagOriginalEntryId property (section 2.2.1.2.9).

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is SendEntryId(0x20)] If this bit flag is not set, the PidTagSourceKey, PidTagChangeKey, PidTagLastModificationTime, PidTagPredecessorChangeList, and PidTagOriginalEntryId properties are not included in the FastTransfer stream.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is SendEntryId(0x20)] For more details, see section 3.2.5.8.1.3.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] SendOptions (1 byte): An 8-bit flag structure.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Request Buffer] [SendOptions] The possible values for this structure are defined in section 2.2.3.1.1.1.1.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.5).
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Response Buffer] [ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Response Buffer] OutputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be the FastTransfer download context.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP Response Buffer] [OutputServerObject] This value MUST be present if and only if the value of the ReturnValue field equals Success (0x00000000).

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP] The RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.4) initializes a FastTransfer operation to download properties and descendant subobjects for a specified folder.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP] This ROP is very similar to RopFastTransferSourceCopyTo, with the following exceptions: The value of the InputServerObject field is limited to a Folder object.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP] [This ROP is very similar to RopFastTransferSourceCopyTo, with the following exceptions:] The FastTransfer stream produced by an operation configured with this ROP wraps folder properties and subobjects with the topFolder element (as specified in section 2.2.4.4).
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP] [This ROP is very similar to RopFastTransferSourceCopyTo, with the following exceptions:] All properties and contained messages are copied.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP] [This ROP is very similar to RopFastTransferSourceCopyTo, with the following exceptions:] The CopySubfolders flag of the CopyFlag field indicates whether subfolders are to be copied.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP] [This ROP is very similar to RopFastTransferSourceCopyTo, with the following exceptions:] Best body logic, as indicated by the BestBody flag of the CopyFlag field specified in section 2.2.3.1.1.1.1, SHOULD NOT be used when copying messages.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP] For details about client behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.3.4.1 and section 3.3.4.2.1.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP] For details about server behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.2.5.8.1 and 3.2.5.8.1.4.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.4).
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be a Folder object.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] CopyFlags (1 byte): An 8-bit flag structure. [0x01, 0x02, 0x04, 0x08 and 0x10]
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] This field defines the parameters of the FastTransfer download operation.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] The following table defines valid flags for the CopyFlags field [0x01, 0x02, 0x04, 0x08 and 0x10].
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the flag name is Move, value is 0x01] This flag SHOULD<6> be ignored on receipt.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R3793001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the flag name is Move, value is 0x01] This flag MAY<7> be set on a download operation to indicate the following: The FastTransfer operation is being configured as a logical part of a larger object move operation, as opposed to a copy operation.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the flag name is Move, value is 0x01] This flag MAY<7> be set on a download operation to indicate the following: The client will issue further operations such as deleting the moved messages from the source.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the flag name is Move, value is 0x01] This flag MAY<7> be set on a download operation to indicate the following: The server does not output any objects in a FastTransfer stream that the client does not have permissions to delete.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R526001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the flag name is Move, value is 0x01] This flag MAY<7> be set on a download operation to indicate the following: When the Move flag is not ignored, if the Move flag is not set, the FastTransfer operation is not being configured as a logical part of a larger object move operation.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] 0x02[Unused1] The client MUST NOT set this flag.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] 0x04[Unused2] The client MUST NOT set this flag.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] 0x08[Unused3] The client MUST NOT set this flag.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is CopySubfolders, value is 0x10] This flag identifies whether the subfolders of the folder specified in the InputServerObject field are recursively included in the scope.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2124, MS-OXCFXICS_R3481, MS-OXCFXICS_R3482.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is CopySubfolders, value is 0x10] For more details, see section 3.2.5.8.1.4.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] SendOptions (1 byte): An 8-bit flag structure.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Request Buffer] [SendOptions (1 byte)] The possible values for this structure are defined in section 2.2.3.1.1.1.1.

[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.4).
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Response Buffer] [ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Response Buffer] OutputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be the FastTransfer download context.
[In RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP Response Buffer] [OutputServerObject] This value MUST be present if and only if the value of the ReturnValue field equals Success (0x00000000).

[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP] The RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.3) downloads the next portion of a FastTransfer stream that is produced by a previously configured download operation.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP] The RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP supports packed buffers, as specified in [MS-OXCRPC] section 3.1.4.2.1.2.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP] For more details about client behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.3.4.1 and 3.3.5.7.1.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP] For more details about server behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.2.5.8.1 and 3.2.5.8.1.5.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.3).
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Request Buffer] InputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be the download context.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Request Buffer] BufferSize (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Request Buffer] [BufferSize (2 bytes)] This field specifies the maximum amount of data (in bytes) to be output in by the TransferBuffer field.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R2141.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Request Buffer] [BufferSize (2 bytes)] For more details, see sections 3.3.5.4.1 and 3.2.5.8.1.5.

[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Request Buffer] MaximumBufferSize (2 bytes, optional): An unsigned 16-bit integer that specifies the maximum size limit when the server determines the buffer size.

[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Request Buffer] [MaximumBufferSize (2 bytes, optional)] This value MUST be present if and only if the value of the BufferSize field is set to a sentinel value of 0xBABE.

[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.3).
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [ReturnValue (4 bytes)] For more details, see sections 3.3.5.7.1 and 3.2.5.8.1.5.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] TransferStatus (2 bytes): A 16-bit enumeration.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferStatus] This field represents the status of the download operation after producing data for the TransferBuffer field.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferStatus] Error (0x0000): The download stopped because a nonrecoverable error has occurred when producing a FastTransfer stream.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferStatus] Error (0x0000): The ReturnValue field of the ROP response buffer contains a code for that error.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferStatus] Partial (0x0001): The FastTransfer stream was split, and more data is available.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferStatus] Partial (0x0001): TransferBuffer contains incomplete data.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferStatus] Partial (0x0001): For details about where to split FastTransfer streams, see section 2.2.4.1.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferStatus] NoRoom(0x0002): The FastTransfer stream was split, more data is available.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferStatus] NoRoom(0x0002): And the value of the TransferBuffer field contains incomplete data.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferStatus] [When the Value is NoRoom, Bit is 0x0002] The server MAY<8> set this value.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R3150001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferStatus] [When the Value is Done, Bit is 0x0003] Indicates this was the last portion of the FastTransfer stream.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] InProgressCount (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [InProgressCount (2 bytes)] The number of steps that have already been completed in the current operation.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [InProgressCount (2 bytes)] This value is only usable for progress information display.

[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] TotalStepCount (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer that contains the approximate total number of steps to be completed in the current operation.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TotalStepCount] This value MAY<9> contain accurate information.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [ TotalStepCount] This value is only usable for progress information display.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] Reserved (1 byte): The value of this field MUST be set to 0x00 when sending and ignored on receipt.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] TransferBufferSize (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferBufferSize (2 bytes)] This value specifies the size of the TransferBuffer field.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] TransferBuffer (variable, optional): An array of bytes that contains the next portion of a FastTransfer stream.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferBuffer (variable, optional)] The syntax of the FastTransfer stream is specified in section 2.2.4.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferBuffer (variable, optional)] This field SHOULD only exist if the value of the ReturnValue field is Success (0x00000000).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R5561.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] BackoffTime (4 bytes, optional): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [BackoffTime (4 bytes, optional)] contains the time, in milliseconds.
[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [BackoffTime (4 bytes, optional)] A client waits before retrying the ROP.

[In RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [BackoffTime (4 bytes, optional)] This field MUST be present if and only if the value of the ReturnValue field is 0x00000480, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.4.

[In RopTellVersion ROP] The RopTellVersion ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.8) is used to provide the version of one server to another server that is participating in the server-to-client-to-server upload, as specified in section 3.3.4.2.1.
[In RopTellVersion ROP] For more details about client behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.3.4.1 and 3.3.5.7.2.
[In RopTellVersion ROP] For more details about server behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.2.5.8.1 and 3.2.5.8.1.6.
[In RopTellVersion ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopTellVersion ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopTellVersion ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopTellVersion ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.8).
[In RopTellVersion ROP Request Buffer] Version (6 bytes): An array of three unsigned 16-bit integers.
[In RopTellVersion ROP Request Buffer] [ Version (6 bytes)] This array contains the version information for another server that is participating in the server-to-client-to-server upload.
[In RopTellVersion ROP Request Buffer] [ Version (6 bytes)] The format of this structure is the same as that specified in [MS-OXCRPC] section 3.1.4.1.3.1.
[In RopTellVersion ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopTellVersion ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.8).
[In RopTellVersion ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopTellVersion ROP Response Buffer] [ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP] The RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.1) initializes a FastTransfer operation for uploading content encoded in a client-provided FastTransfer stream into a mailbox.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP] For more details about client behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.3.4.2 and section 3.3.4.2.1.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP] For more details about server behaviors related to this ROP, see section 3.2.5.8.2.1.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] InputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be either an Attachment object, Message object, or Folder object.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] SourceOperation (1 byte): An 8-bit enumeration.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] This enumeration is used to specify the type of data in a FastTransfer stream that is uploaded by using the RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP (section 2.2.3.1.2.2) on the FastTransfer upload context that is returned in the OutputServerObject field.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] The following table defines the SourceOperation enumeration values and the associated root elements in the FastTransfer stream.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] When SourceOperation enumeration value is CopyProperties, if the value of InputServerObject field is a Folder Object, Root element in FastTransfer stream is folderContent element.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] When SourceOperation enumeration value is CopyTo, if the value of the InputServerObject field is a Folder Object, Root element in FastTransfer stream is folderContent element.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] When SourceOperation enumeration value is CopyProperties, if the value of the InputServerObject field is a Message object, Root element in FastTransfer stream is messageContent element.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] When SourceOperation enumeration value is CopyTo, if the value of the InputServerObject field is a Message object, Root element in FastTransfer stream is messageContent element.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] When SourceOperation enumeration value is CopyTo, if the value of the InputServerObject field is an Attachment object, Root element in FastTransfer stream is attachmentContent element.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] When SourceOperation enumeration value is CopyProperties, if the value of the InputServerObject field is an Attachment object, Root element in FastTransfer stream is attachmentContent element.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] When SourceOperation enumeration value is CopyMessages, Root element in FastTransfer stream is messageList.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] When SourceOperation enumeration value is CopyFolder, Root element in FastTransfer stream is topFolder.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] The following table defines the SourceOperation ordinal values [0x01, 0x02, 0x03 and 0x04] .

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] [When SourceOperation enumeration value is CopyTo, Ordinal value is 0x01] Corresponding ROP of the FastTransfer download is RopFastTransferSourceCopyTo ROP (section 2.2.3.1.1.1)

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] [When SourceOperation enumeration value is CopyProperties, Ordinal value is 0x02] Corresponding ROP of the FastTransfer download is RopFastTransferSourceCopyProperties ROP (section 2.2.3.1.1.2)

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] [When SourceOperation enumeration value is CopyMessages, Ordinal value is 0x03] Corresponding ROP of the FastTransfer download is RopFastTransferSourceCopyMessages ROP (section 2.2.3.1.1.3)

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] [When SourceOperation enumeration value is CopyFolder,Ordinal value is 0x04] Corresponding ROP of the FastTransfer download is RopFastTransferSourceCopyFolder ROP (section 2.2.3.1.1.4)

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SourceOperation] If the FastTransfer stream to be uploaded was produced by a FastTransfer download operation, the value of the SourceOperation field MUST correspond to the RopFastTransferSourceCopy* ROP that was used to configure the download operation.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] CopyFlags (1 byte): 8-bit flag structure.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] This field defines the parameters of the FastTransfer upload operation.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] The following table defines valid flags for the CopyFlags field [0x01] .

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is Move, value is 0x01] This flag MUST only be set if the value of the InputServerObject field is a Folder object or Message object.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is Move, value is 0x01] If this flag is set, the FastTransfer operation is being configured as a logical part of a larger object move operation, as opposed to a copy operation.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is Move, value is 0x01] If this flag is set, the client will issue further operations such as deleting the moved messages from the source.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [CopyFlags] [When the name is Move, value is 0x01] If this flag is not set, the FastTransfer operation is not being configured as a logical part of a larger object move operation.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.1).
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Response Buffer] [ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Response Buffer] OutputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be the FastTransfer upload context.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationConfigure ROP Response Buffer] [OutputServerObject] This field MUST be present if and only if the value of the ReturnValue field equals Success (0x00000000).

[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP] The RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.2) uploads the next portion of an input FastTransfer stream for a previously configured FastTransfer upload operation.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.2).
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Request Buffer] InputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be the FastTransfer upload context.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Request Buffer] TransferDataSize (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Request Buffer] [TransferDataSize (2 bytes)] This value specifies the size of the TransferData field.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Request Buffer] [TransferDataSize (2 bytes)] The value MUST NOT be set to 0x0000.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Request Buffer] [TransferDataSize (2 bytes)] The maximum data size is limited to the available space allowed by the underlying transport used by the EcDoRpcExt2 method ([MS-OXCRPC] section 3.1.4.2).

[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Request Buffer] [TransferDataSize (2 bytes)] The maximum data size is limited to the available space allowed by the Execute request type<10> ([MS-OXCMAPIHTTP] section 2.2.4.2).
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Request Buffer] TransferData (variable): An array of bytes.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Request Buffer] [TransferData (variable)] This array contains the data to be uploaded to the destination FastTransfer object and contains the next portion of a FastTransfer stream.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Request Buffer] [TransferData (variable)] The syntax of the FastTransfer stream is specified in section 2.2.4.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.12.2).
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] TransferStatus (2 bytes): A 16-bit enumeration.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TransferStatus (2 bytes)] Clients MUST ignore the value of this field.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] InProgressCount (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [InProgressCount (2 bytes)] This value specifies the number of steps that have been completed in the current operation.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R31701.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [InProgressCount (2 bytes)] The server SHOULD set this field [InProgressCount field] to 0x0000.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R31701.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [InProgressCount (2 bytes)] This field is usable only for progress information display.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] TotalStepCount (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TotalStepCount (2 bytes)] This field contains the approximate total number of steps to be completed in the current operation.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TotalStepCount (2 bytes)] This field is used only to display progress information.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [TotalStepCount (2 bytes)] However, the value is implementation-specific<11> and not required for interoperability.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R3178001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] Reserved (1 byte): The field MUST be set to 0x00 when sending.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [Reserved (1 byte)] The field MUST be ignored on receipt.
[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] BufferUsedSize (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer.

[In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [BufferUsedSize (2 bytes)] The value SHOULD<12> be the same size as the value of TransferDataSize field if the value of the ReturnValue field is equal to Success (0x00000000).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R318200101.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopFastTransferDestinationPutBuffer ROP Response Buffer] [BufferUsedSize (2 bytes)] otherwise it [BufferUsedSize] can be equal to or less than the value of the TransferDataSize field on failure when the value of the ReturnValue field is not equal to Success (0x00000000).

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure] The RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.1) is used to define the synchronization scope and parameters of the synchronization download operation.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP] The synchronization scope determines the boundaries of a synchronization operation, and is defined by the following: The type of objects considered for synchronization (folders for hierarchy synchronization operations, and messages for content synchronization operations).

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP] [The synchronization scope determines the boundaries of a synchronization operation, and is defined by the following:] The folder that contains these objects as children (contents) or descendants (hierarchy).

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP] [The synchronization scope determines the boundaries of a synchronization operation, and is defined by the following:] The restriction on messages within that folder (contents).
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP] For more details about determining the synchronization scope, see section 3.3.5.5.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP] For more details about client behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.3.4.3.2 and 3.3.5.8.1.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP] For more details about server behaviors related to this ROP, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.1).
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] InputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be a Folder object that contributes to the synchronization scope.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] SynchronizationType (1 byte): An 8-bit enumeration that defines the type of synchronization requested: contents or hierarchy.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationType (1 byte)] This field contributes to the synchronization scope.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationType (1 byte)] The following table defines valid values for the SynchronizationType field [0x01 and 0x02] .
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationType (1 byte)] [When the value of SynchronizationType is Contents, its bit is 0x01] indicates a contents synchronization operation.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [When the value of SynchronizationType is Hierarchy, its bit is 0x02] indicates a hierarchy synchronization operation.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] SendOptions (1 byte): An 8-bit enumeration that identifies options for sending the data.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [ SendOptions (1 byte)] For details about the possible values for this enumeration, see section 2.2.3.1.1.1.1.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] SynchronizationFlags (2 bytes): A 16-bit flag structure that defines the parameters of the synchronization operation.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] The following table defines valid flags for the SynchronizationFlags field [0x0001, 0x0002, 0x0004, 0x0008, 0x0010, 0x0020, 0x0080, 0x0100, 0x1000, 0x2000, 0x4000 and 0x8000].
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [ SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is Unicode, the value is 0x0001] Indicates whether the client supports Unicode.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is Unicode, the value is 0x0001] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is Unicode, the value is 0x0001] This flag MUST match the value of the Unicode flag from the SendOptions field.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is NoDeletions,the value is 0x0002] Indicates how the server downloads information about item deletions.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2165, MS-OXCFXICS_R2166, MS-OXCFXICS_R2167.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the name is NoDeletions,the value is 0x0002] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is NoDeletions,the value is 0x0002] The client MAY implement this flag.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is IgnoreNoLongerInScope, the value is 0x0004] Indicates whether the server downloads information about messages that went out of scope.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2168, MS-OXCFXICS_R2169.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is IgnoreNoLongerInScope, the value is 0x0004] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is IgnoreNoLongerInScope, the value is 0x0004] This flag MUST only be set for a content synchronization download operation.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is IgnoreNoLongerInScope, the value is 0x0004] The client MAY implement this flag.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is ReadState, the value is 0x0008] Indicates whether the server downloads information about changes to the read state of messages.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2170, MS-OXCFXICS_R2171.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is ReadState, the value is 0x0008] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is ReadState, the value is 0x0008] This flag MUST only be set for a content synchronization download operation.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is FAI, the value is 0x0010] Indicates whether the server downloads information about changes to FAI messages.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2172, MS-OXCFXICS_R2173.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is FAI, the value is 0x0010] For more details,see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is FAI, the value is 0x0010] This flag MUST only be set for a content synchronization download operation.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is Normal, the value is 0x0020] Indicates whether the server downloads information about changes to normal messages.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2174, MS-OXCFXICS_R2175.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is Normal, the value is 0x0020] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is Normal, the value is 0x0020] This flag MUST only be passed for a content synchronization download operation.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is OnlySpecifiedProperties, the value is 0x0080] Indicates whether the server limits or excludes properties and subobjects output to the properties listed in PropertyTags.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R2642.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is OnlySpecifiedProperties, the value is 0x0080] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is OnlySpecifiedProperties, the value is 0x0080] This flag MUST only be passed for a content synchronization download operation.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is NoForeignIdentifiers, the value is 0x0100] Identifies whether the server ignores any persisted values for the PidTagSourceKey property (section 2.2.1.2.5) and PidTagParentSourceKey property (section 2.2.1.2.6) when producing output for folder and message changes.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2179001, MS-OXCFXICS_R2178001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is NoForeignIdentifiers,the value is 0x0100] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is NoForeignIdentifiers, the value is 0x0100] Clients SHOULD set this flag.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is NoForeignIdentifiers,the value is 0x0100] For more details about possible issues if this flag is not set, see section 3.3.5.2.3.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is Reserved,the value is 0x1000] This flag MUST be set to 0 when sending.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is BestBody,the value is 0x2000] Identifies whether the server outputs message bodies(2) in their original format or in RTF.<13>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2117002, MS-OXCFXICS_R3118002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is BestBody, the value is 0x2000] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is BestBody, the value is 0x2000] This flag MUST only be passed a content synchronization download operation.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is IgnoreSpecifiedOnFAI, the value is 0x4000] Indicates whether the server outputs properties and subobjects of FAI messages.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2183005, MS-OXCFXICS_R21830051, MS-OXCFXICS_R2183006, MS-OXCFXICS_R21830061.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is IgnoreSpecifiedOnFAI, the value is 0x4000] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is IgnoreSpecifiedOnFAI, the value is 0x4000] This flag MUST only be passed for a content synchronization download operation.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is Progress, the value is 0x8000] Indicates whether the server injects progress information into the output FastTransfer stream.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2675, MS-OXCFXICS_R2188.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is Progress, the value is 0x8000] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is Progress, the value is 0x8000] This flag MUST only be passed for a content synchronization download operation.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationFlags] [When the flag name is Progress, the value is 0x8000] This flag is in addition to the means of progress reporting available through the RopFastTransferSourceGetBuffer ROP results.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] RestrictionDataSize (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer that specifies the length of the RestrictionData field.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [RestrictionDataSize (2 bytes)] This value MUST be set to 0x0000 if the SynchronizationType field is set to Hierarchy ("0x02").
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] RestrictionData (variable): The variable-length restriction structure that is used to limit the data to be synchronized.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [RestrictionData (variable)] This value contributes to the synchronization scope.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [RestrictionData (variable)] This field is used in content synchronizations only.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [RestrictionData (variable)] This field is not applicable if the value of the SynchronizationType field is set to Hierarchy (0x02) as the RestrictionDataSize field MUST be set to 0x0000.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [RestrictionData (variable)] For more details about restrictions, see [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.12.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] SynchronizationExtraFlags (4 bytes): A 32-bit flag structure.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [ SynchronizationExtraFlags (4 bytes)] defines additional parameters of the synchronization operation.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags] The following table defines valid bit flags for the SynchronizationExtraFlags field [0x00000001, 0x00000002, 0x00000004 and 0x00000008].

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the flag name is Eid, the value is 0x00000001] Indicates whether the server includes the PidTagFolderId (section 2.2.1.2.2) or PidTagMid (section 2.2.1.2.1) properties in the folder change or message change header.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R716001, MS-OXCFXICS_R716002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the flag name is Eid, the value is 0x00000001] The server does not include the PidTagFolderId (section 2.2.1.2.2) property in the folder change header when the Eid flag of the SynchronizationExtraFlag field is not set.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the flag name is Eid, the value is 0x00000001] The server does not include the PidTagMid (section 2.2.1.2.1) property in the message change header when the Eid flag of the SynchronizationExtraFlag field is not set.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the flag name is Eid, the value is 0x00000001] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the flag name is MessageSize, the value is 0x00000002] Indicates whether the server includes the PidTagMessageSize property (section 2.2.1.6) in the message change header.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R718001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the flag name is MessageSize, the value is 0x00000002] The server does not include the PidTagMessageSize property (section 2.2.1.6) in the message change header if the MessageSize flag of the SynchronizationExtraFlag field is not set.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the flag name is MessageSize, the value is 0x00000002] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the flag name is MessageSize, the value is 0x00000002] This flag MUST only be set for a content synchronization download operation.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the flag name is CN,the value is 0x00000004] Indicates whether the server includes the PidTagChangeNumber property (section 2.2.1.2.3) in the message change header.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2196, MS-OXCFXICS_R2197.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the name is CN,the value is 0x00000004] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the name is CN,the value is 0x00000004] This flag MUST only be set for a content synchronization download operation.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the flag name is OrderByDeliveryTime,the value is 0x00000008] Indicates whether the server sorts messages by their delivery time.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2198, MS-OXCFXICS_R2199.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the flag name is OrderByDeliveryTime, the value is 0x00000008] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [SynchronizationExtraFlags, When the flag name is OrderByDeliveryTime,the value is 0x00000008] This flag MUST only be set for a content synchronization download operation.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] PropertyTagCount (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer that specifies the number of PropertyTag structures in the value of the PropertyTags field.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyTagCount (2 bytes)] The value of the PropertyTagCount field is set to 0x0000 if the value of the PropertyTags field is an empty array.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] PropertyTags (variable): An array of PropertyTag structures that contains property tags for regular properties and properties that denote message subobjects, as specified in section 2.2.1.7, to exclude or include in the synchronization scope.

[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyTags] PropertyTags (variable): The behavior [property tags for regular properties and properties that denote message subobjects, as specified in section 2.2.1.7, to exclude or include in the synchronization scope] of this field is dependent on the OnlySpecifiedProperties flag of the SynchronizationFlags field.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyTags] For more details about this field, see section 3.2.5.9.1.1.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.1).
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Response Buffer] [ ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the status of the ROP execution.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Response Buffer] OutputServerObject: This value MUST be the synchronization download context.
[In RopSynchronizationConfigure ROP Response Buffer] [OutputServerObject] This value MUST be present if and only if ReturnValue is Success (0x00000000).

[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP] The RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.9) initiates the upload of an ICS state property into the synchronization context.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP] For more details about client behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.3.4.3.1 and 3.3.5.8.2.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP] For more details about server behaviors related to this ROP, see section 3.2.5.9.2.1.

[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.9).
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP Request Buffer] InputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be a synchronization context.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP Request Buffer] StateProperty (4 bytes): A 32-bit PropertyTag structure.

[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP Request Buffer] [ StateProperty (4 bytes)] Valid input is restricted to the property tags of the ICS state properties: MetaTagIdsetGiven (section 2.2.1.1.1), MetaTagCnsetSeen (section 2.2.1.1.2), MetaTagCnsetSeenFAI (section 2.2.1.1.3), and MetaTagCnsetRead (section 2.2.1.1.4).
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP Request Buffer] TransferBufferSize (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.

[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP Request Buffer] [TransferBufferSize (4 bytes)] This value specifies the size of the stream to be uploaded by the RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP.

[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.9).
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamBegin ROP Response Buffer] [ ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.

[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP] The RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.10) continues to upload an ICS state property value into the synchronization context.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS] .
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP] For more details about client behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.3.4.3.1 and 3.3.5.8.3.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP] For more details about server behaviors related to this ROP, see section 3.2.5.9.2.2.

[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.10).
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP Request Buffer] InputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be a synchronization context.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP Request Buffer] StreamDataSize (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP Request Buffer] [StreamDataSize (4 bytes)] This value specifies the size of the StreamData field.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP Request Buffer] [StreamDataSize (4 bytes)] The value of this field MUST NOT be set to 0x00000000.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP Request Buffer] StreamData (variable): This array contains the state stream data to be uploaded.

[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.10).
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamContinue ROP Response Buffer] [ ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.

[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP] The RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.11) concludes the upload of an ICS state property value into the synchronization context.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP] For more details about client behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.3.4.3.1 and 3.3.5.8.4.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP] For more details about server behaviors related to this ROP, see section 3.2.5.9.2.3.

[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.11).
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP Request Buffer] InputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be a synchronization context.

[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.11).
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopSynchronizationUploadStateStreamEnd ROP Response Buffer] [ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.

[In RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP] The RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.8) creates a FastTransfer download context for the checkpoint ICS state of the operation identified by the given synchronization download context or synchronization upload context at the current moment in time.
[In RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP] For more details about client behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.3.4.3.4 and 3.3.5.8.5.
[In RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP] For more details about server behaviors related to this ROP, see section 3.2.5.9.3.1.

[In RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.8).
[In RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP Request Buffer] InputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be either a synchronization download context or synchronization upload context.

[In RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.8).
[In RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP Response Buffer] [ ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.
[In RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP Response Buffer] OutputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be the FastTransfer download context for the ICS state.
[In RopSynchronizationGetTransferState ROP Response Buffer] [OutputServerObject] This value MUST be present if and only if the value of the ReturnValue field equals Success (0x00000000).

[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP] The RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.7) configures the synchronization upload operation and returns a handle to a synchronization upload context.
[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP] For more details about client behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.3.4.3.3 and 3.3.5.8.6.
[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP] For more details about server behaviors related to this ROP, see section 3.2.5.9.4.1.

[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.7).

[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP Request Buffer] InputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be a Folder object that contributed to the synchronization scope that corresponds to the initial ICS state to be uploaded, as specified in section 3.3.5.5.
[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP Request Buffer] IsContentsCollector (1 byte): An 8-bit PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1) value.
[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP Request Buffer] [IsContentsCollector (1 byte)] This value is 0x01 (nonzero) if a synchronization upload is requested for contents of folders.
[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP Request Buffer] [ IsContentsCollector (1 byte)] [This value is] 0x00 if a synchronization upload is requested for the hierarchy of the folder contents.

[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.7).
[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP Response Buffer] [ ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.
[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP Response Buffer] OutputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be the synchronization upload context.
[In RopSynchronizationOpenCollector ROP Response Buffer] [OutputServerObject] This value MUST be present if and only if the value of the ReturnValue field equals Success.

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP] The RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.2) is used to import new messages or changes to existing messages into the server replica.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP are specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP] When there are changes to existing messages, the entire changed message MUST be uploaded.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP] For more details about client behaviors related to this ROP, see sections 3.3.4.3.3 and 3.3.5.8.7.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP] For more details about server behaviors related to this ROP, see section 3.2.5.9.4.2.

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.2).

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] InputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be the synchronization upload context configured for the collection of changes to content.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] ImportFlag (1 byte): An 8-bit flag structure that defines the parameters of the import operation.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] The following table defines valid flags for the ImportFlag field [0x10, 0x40] .
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [ImportFlag, when the name is Associated, the value is 0x10] If this flag is set, the message being imported is an FAI message.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [ImportFlag, when the name is Associated, the value is 0x10] If this flag is not set, the message being imported is a normal message.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [ImportFlag, when the name is FailOnConflict, the value is 0x40] The server SHOULD<14> support this flag.

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [ImportFlag, when the name is FailOnConflict, the value is 0x40] If this flag is set, the server accepts conflicting versions of a particular message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R2231.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [ImportFlag,when the name is FailOnConflict, the value is 0x40] If this flag is not set, the server does not accept conflicting versions of a particular message.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCFXICS_R2232.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [ImportFlag,when the name is FailOnConflict, the value is 0x40] For more details, see section 3.2.5.9.4.2
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] PropertyValueCount (2 bytes): An unsigned 16-bit integer.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyValueCount (2 bytes)] This value specifies the number of structures in the PropertyValues field.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyValueCount (2 bytes)] This value MUST NOT be set to 0x0000.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] PropertyValues (variable): An array of TaggedPropertyValue structures ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.4).

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyValues (variable)] These values are used to specify extra properties on the message; these are properties that cannot be set by using the RopSetProperties ROP.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request] PropertyValues (variable)] The following table[In 2.2.3.2.4.2] lists the restrictions that exist for properties passed in this field.

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [ PropertyValues (variable)] PidTagSourceKey MUST be present in the array list and it has a GID structure ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3) that identifies the message being uploaded in the local replica.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [ PropertyValues (variable)] PidTagSourceKey MUST be present in the index 0 in the position of the array list.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [ PropertyValues (variable)] PidTagLastModificationTime ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.755) MUST be present in the array list.

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [ PropertyValues (variable)] PidTagLastModificationTime ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.755) MUST be present in the index 1 in the position of the array list.

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [ PropertyValues (variable)] PidTagChangeKey (section 2.2.1.2.7) MUST be present and it has an XID structure, as specified in section 2.2.2.2, that identifies a change to a message being uploaded in a local replica.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyValues(variable)] PidTagChangeKey (section 2.2.1.2.7) MUST be present in the index 2 in the position of the array list.

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyValues(variable)] PidTagChangeKey (section 2.2.1.2.7) for details about how clients can generate this value, see section 3.1.5.3.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyValues(variable)] PidTagPredecessorChangeList (section 2.2.1.2.8) MUST be present.

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyValues(variable)] PidTagPredecessorChangeList (section 2.2.1.2.8) MUST be present in the index 3 in the position of the array list.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Request Buffer] [PropertyValues(variable)] < other properties > MUST NOT be present.

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the response buffer of the RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.13.2).
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned 32-bit integer.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Response Buffer] [ ReturnValue (4 bytes)] This value represents the ROP execution status.

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Response Buffer] [ ReturnValue (4 bytes)] For details about the common return values for RopSynchronizationImport* ROPs that require special processing, see section 3.3.4.3.3.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCFXICS_R2449, MS-OXCFXICS_R2450, MS-OXCFXICS_R2451, MS-OXCFXICS_R2452.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Response Buffer] The following table contains one additional return value[0x80040802] .
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Response Buffer] Return value SyncConflict [0x80040802] means a conflict has occurred and conflict resolution failed. No data was imported.

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Response Buffer] OutputServerObject: The value of this field MUST be the Message object into which the client will upload the rest of the message changes.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Response Buffer] [ OutputServerObject] This value MUST be present if and only if ReturnValue equals Success (0x00000000).

[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Response Buffer] MessageId (8 bytes): A 64-bit identifier that specifies the MID structure ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.2) of the message that was imported.
[In RopSynchronizationImportMessageChange ROP Response Buffer] [ MessageId (8 bytes)] This value MUST be set to 0x0000000000000000.
